body:
Can't reproduce. To be fair though, you didn't provide *any example code triggering the error* :) That makes actually helping you a *lot* harder.

I tried:
```java
	@Test
	void testStuff() {
		CtClass<?> ctClass = Launcher.parseClass("public class Foo {\n" +
			"    String binaryIpStart = \"start\";\n" +
			"    String binaryIpEnd = \"end\";\n" +
			"    String sql = \"Select distinct t.NETWORK_IP, t.NETWORK_IP1, t.NETWORK_IP2, t.NETWORK_IP3, t.NETWORK_IP4 \" +\n" +
			"        \"from (SELECT DISTINCT t1.ipv4digit1 || '.' || t1.ipv4digit2 || '.' || t1.ipv4digit3 \" +\n" +
			"        \" || '.0' network_ip, \" +\n" +
			"        \" TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit1) network_ip1, \" +\n" +
			"        \" TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit2) network_ip2, \" +\n" +
			"        \" TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit3) network_ip3, \" +\n" +
			"        \" TO_NUMBER ('0') network_ip4, t1.t2_team_id, \" +\n" +
			"        \" t1.system_owner_id, t1.system_owner_team_id \" +\n" +
			"        \" FROM ip_info t1 \" +\n" +
			"        \" where t1.binary_ip >= '\" + binaryIpStart + \"' \" +\n" +
			"        \" and t1.binary_ip <= '\" + binaryIpEnd + \"' \" +\n" +
			"        \" ORDER BY network_ip1, network_ip2, network_ip3  \" +\n" +
			"        \" ) t order by t.NETWORK_IP1,t.NETWORK_IP2,t.NETWORK_IP3,t.NETWORK_IP4 \";\n" +
			"}\n");
		CtExpression<?> sql = ctClass.getField("sql").getAssignment();
		StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
		sql.accept(new CtScanner() {
			@Override
			public <T> void visitCtLiteral(CtLiteral<T> literal) {
				result.append(literal.getValue());
			}
		});
		System.out.println(result.toString().strip().replaceAll("\\s{2,}", " "));
	}
```

But that correctly produces
```sql
Select distinct t.NETWORK_IP, t.NETWORK_IP1, t.NETWORK_IP2, t.NETWORK_IP3, t.NETWORK_IP4 from (SELECT DISTINCT t1.ipv4digit1 || '.' || t1.ipv4digit2 || '.' || t1.ipv4digit3 || '.0' network_ip, TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit1) network_ip1, TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit2) network_ip2, TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit3) network_ip3, TO_NUMBER ('0') network_ip4, t1.t2_team_id, t1.system_owner_id, t1.system_owner_team_id FROM ip_info t1 where t1.binary_ip >= '' and t1.binary_ip <= '' ORDER BY network_ip1, network_ip2, network_ip3 ) t order by t.NETWORK_IP1,t.NETWORK_IP2,t.NETWORK_IP3,t.NETWORK_IP4
```
which prettifies to
```sql
SELECT DISTINCT t.NETWORK_IP,
         t.NETWORK_IP1,
         t.NETWORK_IP2,
         t.NETWORK_IP3,
         t.NETWORK_IP4
FROM 
	(SELECT DISTINCT t1.ipv4digit1 || '.' || t1.ipv4digit2 || '.' || t1.ipv4digit3 || '.0' network_ip, TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit1) network_ip1, TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit2) network_ip2, TO_NUMBER (t1.ipv4digit3) network_ip3, TO_NUMBER ('0') network_ip4, t1.t2_team_id, t1.system_owner_id, t1.system_owner_team_id
	FROM ip_info t1
	WHERE t1.binary_ip >= ''
	        AND t1.binary_ip <= ''
	ORDER BY  network_ip1, network_ip2, network_ip3 ) t
ORDER BY  t.NETWORK_IP1,t.NETWORK_IP2,t.NETWORK_IP3,t.NETWORK_IP4
```
We are having this issue in our code @I-Al-Istannen , is there any other way to work around it, please suggest.

issue.title: test: adding some tests (pretty-printing and visitor) sql query in string literal issue

repository.name: spoon
repository.description: Spoon is a metaprogramming library to analyze and transform Java source code. :spoon: is made with :heart:, :beers: and :sparkles:. It parses source files to build a well-designed AST with powerful analysis and transformation API.

issue.body:
See https://github.com/INRIA/spoon/issues/5001

I'm adding some tests, all but one pass. Some of the sanity tests (which can be found in the `EvalTest.java` file) were the ones I adapted from @I-Al-Istannen 's comments on the issue,  [here](https://github.com/INRIA/spoon/issues/5001#issuecomment-1305598985) for example.

I also thought of adding some pretty-printing related tests, since I thought that might be another thing that @Vardhamansankar might be trying to do in the issue.

For `SniperPrettyPrinter`, they seem to pass. For `DefaultJavaPrettyPrinter` however, when the parenthesis optimization is _not_ used, they fail. I've made a _much_ more detailed comment [here](https://github.com/INRIA/spoon/issues/5001#issuecomment-2804967607).

So I've added the `fixed = false` flag with the `DefaultJavaPrettyPrinter` test. But I'm unsure if that test is needed and am open to removing the failing test if we want to. If we can tweak the pretty-printer's settings to _not_ print extra parenthesis (which is done with the other test for `DefaultJavaPrettyPrinter`), then I think the test passes -- and I'm not quite sure why we'd be in a scenario where we _need_ extra parenthesis ðŸ¤” 

But yeah, more info in the comment(s) I've linked. Let me know!

cc @algomaster99 @I-Al-Istannen @monperrus

issue.title: [Bug]: Multiple and incorrect parenthesis with DefaultJavaPrettyPrinter on long String variable
